creator: jsummerlin@patriots.uttyler.edu
text:
The problem arises in that it is difficult to remove apache installed from a
source distribution without first packaging it.  There should be an uninstall
directive like that in Wine and other major OSS products that allows a developer
to uninstall apache just as easily as he/she installed it, like:

make uninstall

Thank you.

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
IMO this is a package management problem and out of scope for Makefiles.  There
is so much complexity that could be requested here, not to mention admin policy
decisions; avoiding removing modified config files, having to track across
versions when the set of installed files changes; how to handle non-empty
directories, etc etc.
